QDJDSGHLwauZAKJBc7Tl1g.text: They will not honor your reservation.  Set aside a couple of hours of waiting in line even if you do.

TkK2z6la_7cb4hpNe9w49A.text: Being a regular visitor to the HRC I was a member of their great All-Access programme that meant using my card I could collect points and, more importantly, could get priority seating at any cafe.Unfortunately, it seems without any fanfare or notification, they have discontinued these cards and I have lost any points I had or any benefits I enjoyed are null and void. I can join their NEW scheme though... more money please. Sir.Due to this we postponed our visit until a quieter time and were seated within 20 minutes which was fine for such a busy restaurant. We were seated downstairs in a corner and the food was standard HRC fare, Legendary Burger was good, Spring Rolls are very good (try these!).I just don't think the place has the same appeal as it once did, they don't appear to care about their guitar collections as they once did (most of the ones downstairs were covered in fake cobwebs for halloween to the point of being unrecognisable).The waiters and waitresses used to be attentive and personable but now it seems it's more a case of 'processing' customers as soon as is possible.

ARXsljdwMi7TFwP-Q5ymPg.text: Pretty good food. I had the twisted mac n cheese, my fiance had the legendary burger, we had onion rings on the side and we absolutely loved the barbeque sauce accompanying it.Service was friendly, although it was very busy. When we tried to trade a coupon for a gift with a 30£ bill she told us it was only on giftshopstuff, but she wrote a note for the shop that we would get it and gave us two vault tickets. Her name was laura and she really cared about the visitors, good stuff.It was pretty expensive though.. But it was our first time and it was worth it pretty much.

f5auKLERXE62qYUDctizJA.text: It's become a running joke with my husband and I that every foreign country we go to we somehow always wind up at a Hard Rock Cafe. Not because we're huge fans, but because without fail by the time we're looking for dinner on Sunday nights, HRC's are inevitably the only thing open.I looked forward to this one since it is the original one, and must say, really enjoyed the experience! Our wait was very short, and they managed to find us a booth tucked away in the back near a tv so we could listen to and watch the videos. The wait staff was beyond excellent - our waitress was cute and funny and told us random stories, which were really entertaining.The food wasn't quite as good as the Venetian HRC, but it was pretty decent. Gigantic portions, at least. We asked our waitress to recommend a dessert, so we got a large piece of chocolate cake. The lady knew her desserts! It was amazing. Seriously, get that cake when you go there. So gooooood. One of the best parts was that they played a Cure video. Honestly, Robert Smith adds a star to any dining experience.

ohCrqHnDJKbH0ud5PDk0fA.text: This is the first and LAST Hard Rock Cafe I'll ever go to. I knew it was a tourist trap but at the insistence of my stubborn school group, we all trudged here for dinner. Ye gods, absolutely over priced for sub-standard fare. I can't even remember what I got, it's that unmemorable. Although they did make me laugh for having a sign that said "No drugs or nuclear weapons allowed inside." Well darn! I'll have to put away my bazooka next time I want to pay $30 for a hamburger (American conversion, sorry!)

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Absolutely under no circumstances

wM1wukYAnUfzUW6ghg2sbg.text: Of all the Hard Rock Cafés we ate on Europe, by fair it was the better.  The food was cooked well done.  It was interesting to see well done is a standard in England.  Wonder standard.  The service was what is expected at Hard Rock.  We sat at the bar. Very busy.  The server was eager to service. It was a nice experience .

VKfLm8A29FpKWUWLHCXtbw.text: British food isn't THAT bad, people! If you're enamored with Hard Rock Cafe, this spot won't disappoint, otherwise don't waste your time.Lunched here with family awhile ago. We waited in line since there was such a crowd of tourists hungry to get in. Food was expensive - the exchange rate was pretty horrible for the U.S. Dollar - and the souvenirs more so, but since we were in London, we had to pick up a few t-shirts and sweatshirts. As for their food's taste, a Hard Rock burger is a Hard Rock burger is a Hard Rock burger, no matter where you are.Totally not worth it, regardless of your citizenship.

IKu80MPDAUB50IaT3WFAVg.text: Great spot for satisfying my cravings for Hot Spicy Buffalo wings & Ribs washed down with a few fabulous Margaritas. Gets really busy on a Sat eve, long queues so get there early.Original HRC - does what it says on the label!

yF6bYisKAy1CrfWXkmoyXA.text: Love em or hate em they are an amazing global success story and you can find one in many of the world's larger cities. This was the first one and has been trading since 1971. Offering good quality food at a moderate price and with a heavy dose of Rock and Roll thrown in as well. I am not a regular at these types of places but every now again I visit with friends from out of town for a burger and a few beers before we set off on a shopping trip or a night out. You know what you are going to get and they always deliver it. The Park Lane Hard Rock also houses the vault where they showcase there most valuable rock memorabilia. Dedicated shop just over the road as well, where you can purchase the Hard Rock branded t-shirts, sweat shirts and merchandise and of course they can easily cater for large parties or product launches etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom

Ahu3Q6QClOlqUsuiQr_mWg.text: I used to love this place and it was a must stop on every visit to London. Not anymore. The service has been going downhill, the hostess was rude, and the temperature is never comfortable. It is sad as this is the original and i love all Hard Rocks and always have. This location is permanently off my list.

TGEADCKfSQU8AU1N879SRw.text: Typical Hard Rock experience. The menu is basically the same at every one, and the food is overpriced at every one as well. This was the most expensive meal I've ever had in London... granted, I tend to favor pubs and sandwich shops over the fancy places, but still. For a crab cake sandwich with fries and one drink, I dropped way more money than I wanted to.Bonus points for being the original Hard Rock. And, despite the fact that I complained about the price during and after my meal, I can't argue that it was pretty tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Maryland crab cake sandwich in the foreground, pulled pork sandwich in the back.

Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom

vVxndMwH5768kP9JFu6wLg.text: It's OK.  The Original Hard Rock, What More Can You Say...I Got In Right Away.

XL7xx385ThtwadxoET3nzg.text: Service was outstanding. Resturant was very busy and our waitress was still outstanding. Food was good as always Hard Rock does. Smaller Hard Rock then usual but they handled customers greatly.

jdpj4cuBPASK7WQCuSZI-w.text: Great atmosphere. Our waiter was very good and helped us with all our questions. I'm sure I can say the exact same thing everyone else in here said already. I'll just throw out our only negative. My wife found a small piece of hair in her salad. Not to be gross, but it didn't look like it was head hair, hopefully arm hair. They comped our salad and that was it. Otherwise I would give them a 5 star.

m5KuUkyG5wikmku8kmH1JQ.text: this was one of my favorite meals in London! plus our waitress was so nice & friendly. we always go to hard rock cafes when on vacation because I love to collect the glasses, this one didn't disappoint.

s8jy50e0EXdE-5h8_k5a9w.text: I can't believe I am rating this place 5 stars.I mean, it's a chain!  However, I wanted to go to this place because this is where it all started.  The BIRTHPLACE OF HARD ROCK CAFE. . .how cool is that?!?Well, when I got there the line went around the block.  I am only over here on business so it was just me.  I waited in line for 3 mins and then decided to go see if I could sit at the bar without having to wait in line.  I am glad I did!  While, there are only 2 seats at the "real bar" and those were taken, they have a food bar next to the kitchen with six seats (three and three divided by a column) that is 1st come, 1st serve.  I sat there and had the best, most friendly waitress ever!  I also ordered some weird burger that had grilled apples on it with some weird mustardy type of sauce.  Sounds strange but the burger was to die for and since you are sitting right next to the grill and get to see everything going on in the kitchen, you get your food immediately when it is done.  Was quick, hot and fresh.Was also very cool seeing all the Mick Jagger, Who and Beatles memorabilia on the walls.  I had only been to one other Hard Rock before (Orlando, FL) and this one is much smaller and much more intimate that that one.  Also, the music is not played as loud and the music seems to be that of Jagger, the Who, Beatles, etc. . .which is cool because you are in the UK!Yes, it's a chain but still fun to visit if you want to see the original, one and only Hard Rock!

b7KR_7pP89l4Jn4BhkFEHA.text: Near Hyde Park, I really came here for the pins. This was from an old business trip, but I hunted for pins back then. The London location was interesting especially because of the 1500+ memorabilia. Don't forget, this is the land of rock, pop and contemporary music--so lots of British Invasion 60s stuff from Beatles to the Who. I didn't have time for the burgers, but I can get that anywhere. From what I can see from the door way, it had the same standard HRC format that you see from Fukouka to Honolulu HRCs. I'd say, I enjoyed the London HRC and the Copenhagen Hard Rock Cafe near Tivolli (across the Radisson SAS Hotel and train station)--if it's still there-- because they seem so Americana in places that seem not so USA.

QexxIt_zj_usMIMs2XdCig.text: Okay so it was our first night in London and we had heard the Hard Rock Cafe in London was the first one and we wanted to see it. It was freezing and we had to wait an hour.  I don't know why we didn't just go somewhere else. But when we finally got seated the food was okay and there was a table of teen age girls going to town on some ribs. But it was an experience I will never forget.  Besides, I like to collect the shot glasses.

EY-eDY5dfaB4IDLkGr7BcA.text: We all know that the Hard Rock Cafe is a tourist thing.  Let's stop stating the obvious, now, the night we went while we were on vacation happened to be a good one.  It was during the World Cup and it was Italy vs. _____ ( I really can't remember).  Anyways, the line was really crazy and we waited about 20 minutes.  Extremely long when you're dying of hunger--like the rest of my family, but not that long for someone who wasn't "that" hungry, like me.  We were really lucky with the seating, somewhat away from the bar, but right able to peer down to the kitchen where we saw these lovely burgers.  We ended up getting an awesome, and I do mean awesome waitress as she had been working there for over 30 years.  That's amazing and I don't know how she did it.  She was so very nice to us, and she also asked if it was OK to train one of their new employees.  Sure, why not.  The drinks were always full, and even though he didn't get us a straw she pointed out to him that hey, put it on the table and if they don't take it--oh well, at least it's there. Onto the food.  I believe we all got some type of burger as we were looking right over the kitchen.  She made sure they were cooked perfectly and everything was piping hot.  I guess my experience was a much more positive one than others.  We make it a habit to check out the HRC's whenever we're visiting another country and I guess we were just fortunate to have such a good experience.  I would recommend this spot, but I would also say that if you've been to one--then you've been to them all.  It's just whether or not you want to wait and be surrounded by just a few lovely Americans :-)Have fun peeps

fk0dpZkWLe-nilh8-vFOPg.text: Had a long wait when we went and there wasn't any seating available for waiting. Other than that the drinks were great and so was our bartender! He was really kind and understanding that it was our first time in London and taught us about tipping. Made our hour wait go by faster. When we got seated the food was great and very timely for being busy. My mom got the nachos. They were huge and so worth it. As usual it's always fun to walk around and see the memorabilia as well!

oAqd0OKidwvhn92Q52W2OQ.text: Really enjoyed the food and the cocktails were very tasty as usual.Took a while to be seated but the courtyard out front is quite pleasant - no smoking though. It's definitely the smallest Hard Rock I've been to but the atmosphere is as good as any of the others. We had a window booth - best seat in the house if you can get it!Will return for sure.

v4dR2Y8JaTdXuVfL5Ukb5w.text: This is my 51st Hard Rock Cafe visit and I had to get my shotglass for the collection.  What can I say, this was one of the coolest ones to see.  The line was out the door to eat,  but you might be able to sneak in the vip entrance.  Anyhows, I enjoyed coming to the UK on vacation.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Side door (vip) entrance to the HRC.

-nfRukCDxITbI-LdZtpUaA.text: I went to London few months ago meet this sweet waiter there she said she the original waiters when hard rock open in London. Great service had a blast. Food is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Bacon burger

kdqdD9CAjZbcyEHXf3511A.text: Going here on a busy Saturday night, it's best to have your Hard Rock VIP pass to get in. We were told it would be a 45 minute wait until I asked if having the VIP pass had any advantage. It was! Our name went to the top of the list. We headed to the Rock Shop to look for souvenirs. As soon as we made our purchases, they were ready to seat us. This is one of the smaller cafes, but it's the original cafe that started it all. The restaurant was a bit crowded and as always, loud with rock songs and videos playing. The food and service were good. A fun night!

xt7CyGujVOVEA9DXwCWpZA.text: Very welcoming! Hard rock never dissappoint us! Actually they open the vault museum just because we asked for it and it was amazing!

4jvdAnL-ZLqoIlN1yHjpmg.text: The best thing about London's Hard Rock Cafe must be the memorabilia, as the food really isn't that impressing.

NuzaEQSWl7MRAsAgqEjvfA.text: Timing is everything.....my friends and I new to London walked in and got seated right away. We were told depending on time of day and day of week there would be lines of people waiting to get in. So good luck! As for the food and service... I am a picky person especially about my food. I ordered just a hamburger and fries. My burger did come out a lil pink in the middle, but I ate around it. For some people a lil pink in the middle is the way they like it so i didn't make a big deal about it. My friends had no complaints about there food. Service was good. Stop in and see for yourself, Hard Rock Cafe is the place to go!

h9T9-DBz4ttXB6OzZoF_MQ.text: Out of all the hard rocks I've been too this one was by far the best. Quick service, very friendly to the kids, and all the waiters sang the songs! Very catering to all our needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom

c0WcmzNYfnERMgiYBGOGPQ.text: No Drugs or Nuclear Weapons Allowed Inside.Hey Hey My My Rock And Roll Will Never Die.Before Steve Jobs was insanely great...Rock and Roll was insanely great. And The London Hard Rock Cafe was and is ground zero for many rock and roll fans. The London HRC started in the early 1970's with a donation of a Fender Guitar by Eric Clapton. This is not just a tourist trap restaurant. It is the original HRC and it contains many historical instruments and costumes from famous music legends. Across the street from the restaurant is the gift shop and basement vault that houses some of the more valuable artifacts from Jimi Hendricks, BB King and John Lennon. Tours of the vault, led by the vault master are free. 5 stars for History BuffsBut, the London HRC is also a great popular restaurant. Often packed, with a long wait or long line outside, you can go wait at the gift shop and vault. 4 stars for the wait.Food: Sizzling Fajitas are as good any out there. always a winner. My wife always gets this. For me I get grilled Veggie Sandwich. Always excellent. It gets a solid 4.25 stars on my meatless sandwich scale. Of course, my daughter gets the Burger and Fries. She loved it along with a real milk shake. I've also had the fish sandwich there. 5 Stars over all for the food. For London tourists this is a must see....don't miss destination. If you only had one day in London, this is where you want to have lunch! If you are not a tourist it is a good place for an American Style meal at a reasonable price.In the world of Rock and Roll this is almost as good as it gets. 4.5 Stars over all if you like music. Less if you don't really care.Getting there: Tube: Hyde Park Corner or Green Park. Or long walk from Buckingham Palace.

1VSujCWC8FvifB_tV7b1dg.text: Oh Hard Rock, I love your concept, Food surround by Rock Music.Look how you don't get full stars though, LOOK AT THE MISSING ONE. I'm torn I nearly dropped you to 3 stars, but I couldn't in good concious do that, as I make a point of visiting Hard Rocks whenever I'm in the vicinity.Most of your food is great, I find the burgers a little dry, but the Ribs and Pulled pork turns me into Homer with Doughnuts, and I love the fries.Could not fault the service on the two occasions I went while I was down, really goodYour music during the day is often well not Hard Rock, not even really Rock, it's... pop. At night you seem to pull it back, but why can't it be all the timeI love the walls, infact if I could bypass the queue and promise not to go near the bar or order food I'd love to just go wandering the walls.Out of all the UK, I think I'd rate Hard Rocks Best to worst, Edinburgh, London, Manchester... I need a reason to get myself back up to Edinburgh

aY54WgYBNgpCDW4oMCE2Kw.text: This restaurant has some major problems; many tourists go there but you can't reserve a table. Hence you wait in line outside for a while till they give you a vibration alarm device and tell you to come back in 45 minutes or to start drinking at the bar. Once you have your table you realize it is pretty busy and loud in there. It's not just the loud music, it's the mass of loud people as well which makes this place a very busy one.The staff is very friendly and helpful, quick as well and always offers support. the food is very good, the burgers are classic, sauces delicious and cocktails are very good as well. I would always come back for the food and the experience. I would not if I'm looking for atmosphere and just a a nice place to eat. And the waiting time is usually a real mood killer...

1YgNrswlGM2-iE1gcuk5Kg.text: Hard Rock Cafe! As should be!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom

7lOg8J-prhAqEG2S8yhULw.text: I love hard rocks but this one is small, out dated, dirty, and not consistent. I wouldn't come back..

Y0lGmNmC5gPwitFCJKLPsQ.text: The service in the restaurant was ok, we had to wait 30 minutes until we were seated. This was spent in their shop and outside of the restaurant where we were able to sit at a table with heating. I ordered the salmon and my two friends both got the fajitas. When the salmon came it was a very small portion, and the beans, mashed potatoes and salmon were all low warm. They were not hot so I am assuming that it was not freshly prepared. I did really like that the salmon was cooked on a ceder wood piece which gave it a nice aroma. This dish was definitely not worth the £17.50 that I had to spend. Overall this was a mixed experience for me and also my first time at a hard rock cafe, but I will not be visiting another hard rock cafe anytime soon!

VdRlrlk7byXtx0KicquPGw.text: Great to have visited.. Bought a few shirts of course, nothing brag home about.  But I can say I've been there.   Cold beer please!

9xdNPYEug4HgKEMG93ImcA.text: The Food was decent, the service was really shitty. Our waiter tricked us into getting bottle water instead of regular tap water. That was something I did not appreciate..There was a guy in skinny jeans and floral shirt that was in the front, he was really sassy. I did not like him at all. Overall the service was horrible. I wouldn't come here again.

eQhoInMOg8Yo3Ira_MmTdA.text: My first experience here was one of my best experiences at restaurants in the history of ever!While on vacation I decided to go to the Original Hard Rock cafe just to see whats the haps. When walking to the place I got lost but quickly found it because of the great decorations and neon sign out front. The porch is covered so if you wanted to sit outside to eat or have drinks while you wait for a table inside there's a plant wall that shielded you from the nose of the street traffic and passer-bys. I was there during the Christmas and New Year week of 2012 so it was kind of cold and the restaurant had heaters outside to keep the customers warm while they drank. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. I went there twice on my visit and while there wasn't a wait the first time the second time I went there was a bit of a wait but not by much. The food was great. The first time I went to London I was really sick with the flu and didn't enjoy anything because I couldn't smell (I should have just cancelled but I was to pumped to go, so I went). So everything kind of taste like cough medicine. However I got redemption when dinning at the Hard Rock. On the two different nights I went I had the steak dinner with mashed potatoes and the second night the Swiss Burgers. The drinks were great and the atmosphere was wonderful. It was really nice to see all of the memorabilia from of the Rock Stars. All in all I had a great time and would recommend going for drinks with friends if you ever get to go.

qx7hbJVPambeVsLsXn_-OA.text: First of all I must admit I've worked for this place but I'll just rate it from my experience before I started as a host there.When I was living in Switzerland I came to London quite often to visit people and everytime I went to Hard Rock Cafe at least once during my stay! I absolutely love the atmosphere, the music, the people who work there and the food! My favourite used to be the Honey citrus grilled chicken salad but now I must say the legendary burger, the salmon and pretty much everything else is just as good. For dessert you have to go for the Apple cobbler or the brownie, they are just unbelievable! The servers are always really friendly and chatty and are big part of the experience! In the summer you can sit outside which is lovely. Best is if you go for lunch right when they open cuz in the evenings it's absolutely crazy! You have to wait up to 3 hours which is ridiculous! (When I am hungry I am hungry!!) Go there, try amazing food which is not good for you but sooo good for you, and ROCK ON!

OTWM_73COeVdSB6S90K0JA.text: So this was my firs ever Hard Rock Cafe experience, and it wasn't too bad. After a long day of walking around the london sites, we decided to eat at Hard Rock Cafe. The wait for a table was about and hour long due to the small amount of seating available. The waiting area outside wasn't great. Once seated our waitress was quick to take our order, which was great bc we were starving! I ordered a cheeseburger and I was not disappointed! These portions were huge compared to the standard portions of London.  I would rate an overall 4 stars, but due to the automatic gratuity added to all bills I have to bump it down to 3.

DAedIFHKScVQQGyM7Ek2Cg.text: I make a point to visit the Hard Rock Cafe in every new city or country that I visit. The wait service was good. The crowding was a little annoying, but we are talking about the ORIGINAL HRC! I got in right on time (around 16:00 on a Friday). As I was leaving, the line was wrapping around the building. The Original HRC Vault was quite interesting to see! Rich history locked up down there. I recommend visiting this place during your London visit!

nA3-7qDQ4vUPvFSq7t_2Fw.text: You can find the standard American fare for burgers and sandwiches at the Hard Rock, but very tasty. Drinks are also good. We had a good time and I espeically like the music videos there playing.

nt_-uzUOs0oGXCR2JQX5Pw.text: Rock (eel) & (cheese) Roll!!What great places these are! Lettuce give thanks!

K9ZmuhmmCWit_XiOvOC2-Q.text: only been there once, think it's good. quite expenisive but very good, wud recomdend this 2 anyone

p6cBpqovSjUmMrWL3rNjng.text: Been to a few of the cafes in the world and this was the poorest one. Long waits even though i have a privalege card and staff very unhelpful.oh and very expensive

VXSQDFA5H-KuTPEd24YVYQ.text: This was certainly an immensely memorable experience for me. I have been there only twice yet I definitely feel as if I have established such a strong bond with the hard-working and amicable waiters/waitresses and chefs, it is evident that these individuals are so proficient and work immensely hard due to the fact that there are so many people to deal with, yet they still have time to converse with their customers and diners and are very well-spoken and socially active. If there was an option, I would give them more than five stars, easily the top three of the restaurants which I have attended and the food was definitely delectable and flavorsome. I will absolutely be re-attending soon and have introduced this fine establishment to many of my friends via WhatsApp and Twitter. Exquisite decoration and wonderful rock music, I have also conversed with the fellow clientele, many of which were from the United States, excellent to talk to, very cool individuals and it was pleasurable having such an excellent time. This certainly will be a common occurrence.

Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom

00pJseAsGZhgjaK6RZr0RA.text: I always stop at Hard Rock and buy a pin and shirt if I find one I like.  I have a rewards account and used it to buy the pin.  I then saw my fav shirt in London edition here and went back to purchase that as well.  This is what my husband refers to as, the "psych out" because I always find something after he thinks we're done and have to go stand in line all over again.  Haha. The gal checking us out the second time didn't speak English as her first language obviously, and she had me write down my email so she could find my account.  She then proceeds to tell me that she can't find me, although they had just done the exact same thing not 5 minutes earlier when I bought the pin, I asked her if she had mis-typed it or something since we'd not had any problems a few minutes ago and she completes the sale.  I said, "Did you just finish the sale without giving me the points?!"  She goes, "Yeah, you said you'd just used it and you can only use it once a day."  I proceeded to tell her that we didn't "use" anything we simply typed in my info for the rewards, she clearly misunderstood and kept talking about how you can only use your account once a day - if you are redeeming points.  You can use it however many times you like if you are BUYING things.  She wasn't getting it - and I was pissed - and it was only like 20 points anyway.  Still... ugh.

jhjtNJnj8YOliLC_hCd5YQ.text: My bucket list is to attempt to visit all HRC locations!!  So, I'm now crossing off The Original London location!As a Hard Rock fan can one appreciate where it all began. It was amazing to finally say I made it and appreciate the history. I came back several times and dined at the bar and enjoyed the views and memorabilia.Being a Rewards Members also had its benefits by not having to wait in the hour long line, I was seated immediately. Staff was friendly and especially courteous to this foreigner and appreciated my travels. I've been to over 50+ HRCs, however, Yelp hadn't been established so to legitimize my visits I'm going back to several of them to check in and also mark off my new HRC interactive map locations.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Rock Shop Across the Street
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Signage outside
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Rock On at the Original HRC!!

0sXAmRvKobE2S_I3dvYyKw.text: After arriving in London late Friday morning, we jumped on the sight seeing "Big Bus" tour, rode around for about two hours and then decided we were hungry. We drove past the Hard Rock while on the tour and decided to walk back to it from the bus stop. Upon arriving at the Hard Rock, we were cold and wet from the rain, the host told us it would be about a 35 minute wait but we were more than welcome to "sit in the bar" while we waited.  Let me tell you about the bar, it was small, very small, and had 3 seats, which were all taken.  The bartender was extremely nice and very attentive. My cousin accidentally knocked her drink over on the bar and he immediately made her another one, free of charge. The drinks were subpar, I ordered what the guy told me was their "strongest" cocktail and it was laughable, literally could not taste any alcohol in it whatsoever.  The food was good, but not spectacular, definitely nothing to write home about.  It's your typical American style food, with a slight British twist.  The prices were pretty high, I thought. 3 cocktails, 1 beer and 2 meals cost us around £75.  Definitely not worth the price. Better food at a better price can be found all over the city.

fLVaXnoVhIULmdIJ9pIZsA.text: The original Hard Rock Cafe. It's a burger place but a cool burger place. My friend had a Hard Rock Cafe card which meant we skipped the queue. It has iconic rock memorabilia. If you sit at a table with an Eric Clapton guitar above you that's his spot (he was a regular when it first opened) and that guitar is the first memorabilia given to the cafe. If you don't like the memorabilia blame that guitar. The burgers are tasty and the drinks refreshing and you can purchase the glass ware for a discount if you drink at the restaurant. My friend has one from each Hard Rock she's been too. The staff are friendly and busy so very busy.It is expensive. It is a tourist trap. So beware there are other burger places that do better burgers. For a tourist change it good.

uirCuuwDu4lWPxtklNY3HQ.text: When some friends came to visit a couple of weeks ago we went to the Hard Rock Cafe in Piccadilly for lunch on one of the days. I've been to a couple of Hard Rocks across the world but this was the first time I'd been to the London branch.The cafe is very popular with tourists so if you don't have a reservation be prepared to wait. We arrived at just after 1pm on a Saturday and there was a short queue but we couldn't have been waiting more than twenty minutes before we were seated.Let's be clear, Hard Rock Cafe isn't somewhere you go for peace and quiet or a romantic meal out, it's busy and noisy but has a fun atmosphere and plays great music. If you do have to wait you can just pitch up at the bar and since the soft drinks are bottomless you don't have to spend a fortune either unlike at some establishments.We were seated in the downstairs areas which is actually quite a bit bigger than upstairs but was still jam packed with people. The choices include pretty standard American style food; burgers, salads and sandwiches, an excellent dessert menu and an even better choice in cocktails!Having perused the menu the boys settled on some epic looking burgers while I went for the famous Hard Rock fajitas with grilled chicken and shrimp. (That's prawns to us Brits!) When the food arrived we weren't disappointed the portion sizes were pretty decent.I was given four small wraps with my fajitas which was enough for me as that was about the limit as to what I could eat but there was at least enough food left over to make two or three more and for once in my life I didn't complain about not having enough guacamole! Every bite was delicious but sadly that meant that there was no room for pudding - guess that just means I'll have to visit again.The service was pretty slow and it took us quite a while to actually place our order in the first place and indeed get the bill to pay at the end of our meal but given how busy the restaurant was this was I guess this is just to be expected.

6vJObiIEUV13e_44k4AMeg.text: Awesome hamburger and lovely service, we were there at the original Hard Rock Cafe in London and by coincidence we were there on the night of their 44th anniversary so the hamburgers were only 71 pence, which in US dollars is only $1.10, we scored as the regular price today is $16, and it was delicious to boot.  We chatted with the host and waitresses who were all super friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Happy 44th anniversary special cheeseburger for 71 pence

chwFIQv_NKReSIFmpxv9SA.text: We went here because it is the original Hard Rock and that seemed like a cool novelty.  However, we sat on the patio and didn't really get the Hard Rock experience.  I made my kids come with me to the bathroom so that we could walk around and see the memorabilia.  The food was good and we enjoyed it...but the premium we paid for being at a Hard Rock was kind of lost.  So, as convenient as the patio may be, I don't recommend it if you want to actually experience being at a Hard Rock.

yX3piNovkW1XKN8z-id4sQ.text: Bare with me... I forgot to post this!It was that time of year again, time to head to Winter Wonderland with the partner in crime, but alas the rain did fall.  In fact the rain was so heavy it actually hurt when it landed on you!  This could only mean one thing...No trip to Winter Wonderland is complete without a stop here, and they are one of my favourite restaurants.We had a 45 mins wait for a table, so we headed round to The Back Room, the awesome little bar hidden behind the Hard Rock.  The ceiling reminded me of a church, the walls were filled with graffiti, and they had Sky Sports on the big screen; perfect.Our buzzer then went mental and we grabbed our coats, stomachs rumbling to get our table.The cheese and bacon burger is always what I order and it's always amazing, oo I went against all my heart and ordered something else. I was feeling a little crazy, and you didn't see that coming did you?!The Texan; pulled chicken, Chipotle and Hickory Bar-B-Que sauce, cheddar cheese, crispy jalapenos and crispy onions. Oh yes.  It was served with citrus coleslaw and cowboy beans.The partner in crime had similar, minus the crispy jalapenos and crispy onions, and we both enjoyed equally! I'm rather glad I made the decision to steer away from my normal choice!  I'd recommend both of this to anyone!  Plus being chicken I felt slightly less guilty that having a burger!To top it all off we were sat in the Sex Pistols/Public Image Ltd. area so I was well in my element.  It's like they knew I love them!  I want the red bondage boot so bad!We didn't have space for desert, so we paid up and headed off to Winter Wonderland.  The rain had stopped if you were wondering!

ox8jwQPO412YSt_7jjWyDg.text: Hard Rock is one of those places you should probably come to once, especially this London one, being the original.We've been a few times over the years, and it's always crazy busy. This time we went at 5pm on a Saturday (with a reservation - always go with a reservation!) They told us it'd be a 15 minute wait but then someone else called us right in and took us to our table. I'd won a competition and our meal was on the house, this time from the special chilli menu. We were treated really well, and looked after attentively. The food was a bit slow to come but considering they were completely full and had a queue out the door, that's to be expected.Our burgers were really nice - we both ordered them without chilli (as it has beans) but the burger was well cooked, and not too dense. It had a cheese sauce and jalapeno salsa, both of which should be served on everything they sell. It needed some bacon and in hindsight, I should have asked for some.Then we had the chilli chocolate brownie with ice cream. I thought it was pretty good and enjoyed it but there wasn't any chilli taste as far as I could tell.The 5th star is lost due to the delay with the food, and the fact that it's really, really expensive - the chilli burger and plain chips was £17.25, which is pretty crazy. But if you're there for the experience, it might be worth it to you!

AdaJo6mEwCUOsBHx9jjTpw.text: I have been to Hard Rock Cafes all over the world.  I value the reliability & consistency of their menu, the fun atmosphere, the memorabilia & of course the music.  London's location proved no exception.  My litmus test, as ever, is their honey mustard grilled chicken sandwich & it, along with service, was terrific, despite the restaurant being insanely busy even for what one might consider an off hour of 3:30 p.m.I was in a bit of a rush, or I'd have explored more.  I do hope to return at some point.

Sq7vmmBgTj2WFpUZid_Cug.text: I've visited a few of these joints around the world and I got the best vibe here. Super friendly service, quick and good food, and no wait for a seat at lunch. Being the first ever Hard Rock, I put it on my list, despite my preference for visiting local joints. But, I'm glad I did and I suggest you do the same.

NeMR8-YPZdstixNki9ZozQ.text: I feel like the Hard Rock Cafe gets a bad rap. There are Hard Rock Cafes all over the world after all, one in every city more or less, especially in the kitch landscapes of Florida and Vegas. But people, London is the ORIGINAL, opened in 1971 with help from Eric Clapton and Pete Townshend among others. It is a rock mecca and an authentic American cuisine trendsetter.Starting the trend for proper American food, which is still raging today with places like Meat Liquor popping up all over London, the eats are classic, delicious, saucy dreams come true. My dad was here when it opened, and I still visit with him today. You really can't beat their buffalo wings, smoked ribs, Texan pulled pork sandwiches or legendary burgers. The bar is also home to some of the greatest cocktails around, including the brilliant Electric Blues (nothing tastes better than a bright blue cocktail)Come for the history, come for the music, and come for the wings! This place is the original and best.

AYBfnw5OH9iwMchoq9OjHw.text: This is the original Hard Rock Cafe, a brand which can now be seen all around the world - in fact it's a rare trip abroad where there isn't a Hard Rock nearby. We meant to go to the one when we were in Bucharest recently but just didn't get around to it. Getting to the London one can be a little tricky - the road outside isn't pedestrian friendly with a massively complicated series of underpasses through the roundabout (it's more than a roundabout, but you know what I mean).I've been here numerous times now, and the service is very friendly - always on that American level. You almost forget sometimes that you're actually in London still at times since the service is so good. The menu used to be quite expansive, but they've reduced it down now - a wise move I think as it only appears to be the things that can be cooked in a decent time. The menu is pricey, and I wouldn't suggest that you bother with the starters since they're quite small for the price.So why am I giving out four stars? Frankly because the place is so iconic. I've had good meals here and some particularly dreadful one - but in recent trips it's been getting a lot better. We tried out the chilli menu and the burger was really good - pricey but good. If you're into your music then you have to come here even if it's just to have a drink at the bar and admire the memorabilia. The Rock Shop is nearby (that's rock music, not "they're minerals, Marie") which in itself is pretty cool. Overall; The original? Yes. The best? No. But it shows signs of improvement in recent visits.

hEDbwigXSo95--7V4m8sJA.text: I broke one of my cardinal travel rules my first night in London - never eat somewhere that you can eat at at home.  It's mostly good for avoiding fast food like McDonald's.  But I was caught in a wave of nostalgia, remembering my first trip to London in 1977 during college, eating at the very first Hard Rock ever, co-founded by Issac Tigrett, a graduate of my alma mater.  There was a Centre College pennant on the wall which made us proud (this was before they started collecting rock-'n-roll memorabilia a couple of years later).  But this felt different and for good reason.  They'd moved from the original location in a former Rolls Royce dealership into a smaller space.  I was a surprised at how small it felt and of course the Centre pennant is long gone.  There's always a line at any Hard Rock I've visited and the tried and true way to get seated quickly is to eat at the bar, so that's what I did.  The menu in London is similar to, if not exactly the same, as menus in most of the Hard Rocks I've eaten at.  I went with the no fail Big Cheeseburger, swapping my fries for onion rings (wonderful), washing it all down with a couple of Boddington brews.  It was pretty good including Dan, my server.  Desserts looked downright sinful and I managed to resist this time around.  Look at your receipt carefully because it shows that an optional service charge has been added for the London Hard Rock staff.  I guess that's code for you can always leave more.  Afterwards I stopped in the Rock Store and bought a couple of Hard Rock London pins.  My favorite was an iconic red phone booth with a door that opened.If you like the Hard Rock experience and don't mind an American-centric menu by all means stop by.  It's a piece of Hard Rock history.

SAYS4fev4H649W-z8j192g.text: Had the veggie leggie burger    It was the best veggie burger ever.  The staff was very good. M daughter had Mac chicken and cheese.  It was delicious.  Great vibe.

43dJhw7SEm4Vka5J3zowrA.text: I am not given to hyperbole, and my visit here prompted me to look up the history of this place, although I've been coming to the hard rock café my entire adult life.This is the best hard rock café on the planet, which may or may not be attributable to the fact that it was founded here.My wife and I have been to this restaurant all over the US, and for the last three years all over Europe and the United Kingdom, and this one here in London is the best we've ever been to.From the greeter to the waitstaff, to the bartender to the kitchen, absolutely head and shoulders above any other hard rock café in this part of the world. The fact that they have olives which was a bridge too far for Rome, Paris, Mallorca, Berlin, and the rest of Europe. To the speed and quality of the kitchen, to the skill of the bartenders.

Ov6taMEQ4rzcX_uiBcRd6Q.text: One of the best Hard Rock cafes  have ever been to. We went to the store first where a tour of the Vault was just starting. The Hard Rock gentleman let us in behind the bars and there was lots of memorabilia in there. He told us the story of the Beatles and Hendrix, it lasted about 30 minutes, he was very detailed. He even helped take pictures. It was a fun experience. We then headed to the restaurant which had an outdoor patio and two levels filled with memorabilia. There was a shirt from U2's Bono in the lower level amongst many other musicians clothing and guitars. I ordered a Burger and Fries. I told the sever to make sure the fries were fresh and they weren't.  He got me new fries and they were perfect. The burger tasted really good.

The interior is classic Hard Rock Cafe. The menu is extensive and I enjoyed my grilled chicken breast with cheese and bacon and a side of fries. mzx4Bf258ULZS3t16b3nyg.text: Haven't been here in years but so glad we stopped by to reminisce. Drinks are yummy and I get to take my glass home as souvenir. Alex offers exceptional service. He deserves 5 stars for his service. It's a great tourist spot.

YT81ry1YEK5ggl9MEoPVIg.text: I'm not totally sure why I decided that I needed to come here while in London.  I mean honestly, if you've seen one Hard Rock, you've basically seen them all.  But for some weird reason I was drawn to this place.I came in to grab some lunch and was promptly seated at the bar area, or I guess whatever that area was called, it really wasn't a bar and it kind of overlooked the kitchen/serving area.  The hostess that had seated me was informative of the place and had asked me where I was from.  When I said Pittsburgh she automatically said Pennsylvania, then she second guessed herself, but then again came back to PA, it was a nice conversation and a welcoming gesture.  Sitting at this bar area you got to see the food be prepared and watch the staff interact with one another.  They were enthusiastic and entertaining for sure.After browsing the menu I finally decided on what I wanted.  My server was right on top of things, like anytime I needed things he was magically there.  I had placed my drink order, still water, and when he came back I placed my order.  I decided on the Guinness bacon cheeseburger with a side of Guinness beer cheese fries.  When this thing appeared it was massive.  I now understand why so many places serve their burgers with steak knives.  What drew me to this burger was the fact that it was combining Guinness and Jameson on a burger.  The cheese contained the Guinness but what I was more interested in trying was the Jameson bacon jam.  You would think this thing would be salty, but for some reason it did not have that overwhelming salt flavoring.  In fact the flavors melded so well that I devoured that thing quickly, along with the Guinness cheese covered fries.After I finished and paid I decided to make my way to the store area, which is actually across the small street.  Of course you want to buy a shirt or what not to let people know you went to a Hard Rock Cafe.  I browsed and picked out a couple of shirts and paid.  If you want, you can stick around a bit in the store area and go to the Vault.  I didn't, but I hear it's a small museum.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Guinness bacon cheeseburger with a glass of still water.

5e9SIMMN_rEoz0H4F8fjew.text: I've been to Hard Rock Cafe's all over the world and the service and experience here was just overpriced and terrible.  We were starving and this appeared to be the closest place to get some food.  They pushed hard for us to sit outside (which I didn't mind) because I guess there were no tables inside.  We sat and were brought water.  I ordered coffee and what I got was nasty and resemblance of coffee.  It was lukewarm and burnt. When the waiter realized I wasn't drinking it I expected him to offer to make a new pot, no, he offered to warm it up in the microwave for me.  I said no thank you and he took it off the bill. The food itself was average.  I've had better chicken fajitas at other Hard Rock Cafes for much cheaper.  The most annoying part had to be the wait.  We were done for a solid 15 minutes before they took anything away and then when it came time to pay he could not get the credit card machine to work which took us an additional 20 minutes.  The food itself was okay and the service was poor.  The food is also very expensive for two people with no drinks it ended up costing almost $100.00, no thank you.Skip this on your trip, if you want a good Hard Rock go to the one in Orlando.  It's the biggest in the world, has better food, and better prices.

ooZNa4ZWMRN3MCAyzZxAFQ.text: One out of three entrees was quite good, their Cobb salad. Don't order the traditional club sandwich. I asked for it NOT toasted so that it would not rip up my mouth. The bread was very hard. Obviously stale or had been sitting out for hours. Sent it back and the second set of bread was about half as stale, but still clearly not fresh. They must toast it to hide the stale bread. They also served stale bread with the macaroni and cheese which was flavourless. Not impressed. And the music was turned up much louder partway through the meal to the point we had to practically yell to hear each other. Service was mediocre. One server argued that the bread was not toasted the first time. I could knock it on the table...

iAjmg168gLwuTx8Vxw5F4A.text: I do love my Hard Rock Cafes! I think I've visited around 25 of their restaurants by now! Great experience as always. We were seated quickly even though there was a small queue outside and our food came out really quickly as well. We were seated downstairs so you have a bit more room than upstairs in the main restaurant, where it can be a bit of a squeeze, although the music downstairs was a bit loud and overpowering. Our server kept encouraging us to have cocktails or add additions to our dishes, he was really nice and really wanted to look after us. My sister and I both went for the Fiesta Burger due to the guacamole! It was delicious. My sister did ask for bacon on hers after the server 'up sold' on the toppings and then they forgot to add it! We shared a side dish of Mac & Cheese which was also delicious. We were both stuffed by the time we had finished, so couldn't fit in dessert. It was a solid burger, really enjoyed it. The London Hard Rock is definitely one of their better cafes and I've never had a bad experience here. What made this visit even sweeter was the discount I had from having their reward card! £12.00 off my bill. Bonus!

BY5RXxKsmh2j5YkRj5xuSA.text: I went to hard rock cafe, i made a reservation through website, but i waited 20 mins! Anyway the service was good, the staff are helpful and kind.The food was below my expectations.The burgers were tasteless, i had to put the sauce in each biteI won't visit it again, or maybe I'll go just for the appetizers and atmosphere.

_3_8zsQ6IoZFrvXsRvRf8Q.text: Love this place.  Never tire of it!  Loads of memorabilia lining the walls and they even have the Vault with more memorabilia across the road which you can go in for free. They really know how to celebrate too.  It's their 45th Anniversary, and they have opened their doors to everyone to dine at 1971 prices. The queues are massive and there is torrential rain, so they gave everyone a plastic poncho to keep dry.  When the sun came out, they started giving out ice cream.  The restaurant was jammed packed but the service was still attentive and friendly.  Everyone is having a great time. The atmosphere as always is great.  A place where you never get bored, the food is always good, burgers are yummy, the rack of ribs are large and all very tasty. Prices decent.I would go again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Tasty huge ribs
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. HRC Burger
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Fab anniversary cake

Y1_03C2dEUwrVxix0aHipw.text: If you're a music history fan, then definitely come here. And go to the vault across the street. The food was okay. The drinks were not great, under alcohol-ed, and took too long. The patron noise level was high. The wait can be long too. I'm glad I went, but I don't need to go again.

fzmm1ab095jUOYIqjWuolg.text: We came here during a recent trip to London to take a look at the first ever Hard Rock Cafe. I was underwhelmed as far as hard rocks go. The bar area was small and crowded. There wasn't a clear waiting area while you were waiting to be seated. And the outdoor seating available was minimal. Prices were high as expected and the food was subpar. The drinks were so light we had to ask our server if it was an alcoholic beverage. They did add liquor to it which was nice. Definitely somewhere you go for the experience rather than the food.

avgQk_OYmkWeAGlxt9msdQ.text: As always Hard Rock cafe doesn't disappoint! Great as always this place has a unique vibe of rock n roll combined with great food.I generally take the Legendary burger and it's simply put one of my favorite dishes ever. The onion rings are better than anywhere else and the fries are beautifully crisp, perfectly salted. The Burger itself is big, really big, so I definitely keep that in mind before you order it. I also highly recommend the fajitas (personally I go for the combo but I'm sure the others are good too), the NY strip steak, and the Jumbo Combo as a starter. The atmosphere as I said is really nice. The music is great and there's always something to look at! I would actually recommend this for a birthday celebration or any kind of celebration.As for price, you need to keep in mind that this is a touristic attraction. Most of the customers are tourists so obviously the prices won't be the same as at Spoons. Then again the quality of your food is also very good so keep that in mind as well. The cokes are also refillable which is great! All in all, I'd say that prices could be better but considering the fact that it's in central London, it's really not too bad at all.As for the service, it's mostly great. However there have been a few misses from past experiences. I think this is mainly due to the fact there are too many customers and the amount of orders can be a bit overwhelming. A possible to fix would be to hire more waiters to make the experience more enjoyable for everyone. Yet, judging from my last experience, service was great and the waitress (of which I forgot the name) was super nice and helped us get our food as quickly as possible as my friend had to catch a flight shortly after.Considering that this is the first Hard Rock Cafe in the world, it definitely lives up to its name.

n0bZMxGdpRP7jtCSZVBcDA.text: Call it tacky, call it plasticcy. I DON'T CARE I LIKE IT HERE! Although i never actually come here. I like it. I used to work in advertising so had some dealings with Hard Rock then. This meant yummy lunch and burgers and fun and silliness. And feeling a bit like a tourist. Brilliant. If you have time, go and see their little museum, their wonderful tour guide is a lot of fun, and you get to see some brilliant music memorabilia. I was Bob Dylan's hat. In my lunch break. While I was officially working. It's hard not to like the place after that.

9DgfWkUG-dRc4rmZ32-8tg.text: I tired the BBQ ribs today. It is really a "hard rock". It was the worst rib I have had. Service was also very bad.

SOhC6jzdjYoU58XrrCocdg.text: I went to the hard rock café with colleagues and straight away I have to say that the portions here are challenging.i.e. we ate there last night (starters + mains) and I'm writing this at 12:17pm the following day and I've still not touched food. The nachos can feed 4 and if you're trying to decide between the ribs and the steak I'd say go with the ribs. Also they do certain cocktails and shooters in branded glasses which you get to take home An amaretto coffee at the end will help with digestion, so they say Expect American waiters / bar tenders, priceless memorabilia on the walls and 80s rock anthems

r7fqvBebde7k9jdw8mr8Jw.text: not a good place- will never recommend it to anyoneand I don't understand why people are queuing in front of it to get a seat- what is special there- I have no idea you can easily find a better restaurant with way more edible food steak and chicken we had - after 45 minutes wait- were so disappointingthe place where we seated was no clean but service was friendly

z_-WpcjcdBB2v5OKJq_kGw.text: I went there for my 16th birthday and it was amazing. i love the decor and although it is pricey, the food was top notch and the service was also more than efficient. It is in a great location and always seems to be busy!I would recommend any of their steaks and must admit that it was one of the tastiest and most enjoyable meals of my life to this dayI intend to go back there very very soon and writing this review has brought back some very fond memories!I am going to stick my neck on the line and say that hard rock cafe serves the best steak in London!

1ugf-5PeY4pmgIFHJaCU0A.text: The original Hard Rock - this is where it all began, many moons ago! It is difficult not to get caught up in the excitment of knowing that you are dining in a place of rock history. The staff are really good and we were served by one of the original waiting staff who worked there when the cafe first opened! The food is great & you get generous portions (try the nachos, it's listed as a starter, but you could easily get 3 courses out of them!) the music is awesome, but you have to be a fan of rock, otherwise you may get a bit bored. Occassionally there are live acts in the bar area, check the website for listings. The Hard Rock Cafe shop is across a small road opposite the restaurant

HwEUu78_i1K0Gnxx16VjLw.text: First visit to Hard Rock Cafe and maybe my last..! After my visit I questioned my age! Am I too old to visit Hard Rock Cafe! I went with my partner - no children - just the two of us - we sat downstairs - I couldn't handle the noise upstairs! The food was okay - it's burgers , chips and heart attack food - but all cooked well It's not my sort of restaurant but lots of others were having a great time! One other comment, the waiting staff were all eastern european and american - not a brit in sight!

VTX5GMJAkeBw-qcbuQr6Qg.text: I really enjoyed my visit to Hard Rock Cafe in London and we have visited a few around the world. The staff were very helpful and even when we had a change of server they both came over to explain what was happening. It was very busy when we visited on a Friday evening without booking but they were really helpful and we had a drink at the bar of less than 10mins before we had a table.It was rather expensive but we are talking a restaurant in London it was no more expensive than Cardiff where we have a lower standard of living. Good choice of food and was good quality.

Zd4JZb57oHtvyAZD0fM5pg.text: I went here at the weekend and have to say I wasn't impressed. The food was overpriced and tastless and the view not great. Plus the music was so loud we were unable to talk to each other. Having said that Hard Rock Cafe doesn't claim to be a fantastic restaurant, it is what it is and the service is friendly and quick once you're seated.

UWQIfaYmju28p-FdOxnXMg.text: Very poor Booked as part of a package with the Apollo Theatre in Victoria - eat before the show - will not do this again. Table booked for 5.30pm (needing to leave by 7.00pm for the show) but not seated until 6.20pm even though they knew we had restricted time. Set menu on this package was basic and applied rigourously (eg. soft drink included but not water. If water wanted you have to pay extra). Food cold on arrival and had to be sent back. Had to leave before eating the included destert due to time pressures. Staff very apologetic (plenty of experience perhaps) but overall experience very poor. Not recommended.

DmtC_Nfxg3IeewvBpRYbXg.text: The original, the first Hard Rock Cafe.  The mother store which launched the whole chain.  The food's all the same.  We went looking for the shop which is not in the restaurant but down the street a bit in a storefront by itself.  Still, it was kinda cool to walk into "the original" where rockstars, movie stars and celebs have been before you.

3sk4P6AvXWOQfc4CjW0FAg.text: This is the original location and, like every other Hard Rock Cafe you'll find anywhere in the world, it's very noisy and serves food that's mediocre and overpriced . . . and yet the crowds still come.

M9omWgJrUKAmeCfRbZpveQ.text: A lovely restaurant with a great gift shop! A brilliant place to bring all of the family with food to suit everyone. Wonderful staff and a beautifully decorated restaurant.

No3QFZoKAqKgXWVX1IjKSQ.text: I love the Hard Rock Cafe, I can't help it. When I'm abroad I always try to visit them whenever there's one nearby. The London Hard Rock has a really good vibe and serves some great good. I've been a few times just for a drink rather than a meal and that's great too. This is one place I would definitely return to again and again.

CNpJE3CZ2dUaCVKiTiHrsw.text: Most Hard Rock Cafes, I give 3 stars because the food is decent but overpriced, and there is always a wait. The restaurant is known for loud restaurants because of the loud music and the many tourists, which shows the chain must be doing something right. This particular location earns an extra star because it has a museum full of music history memorbilia. If you are lucky enough to get invited into the museum, you can touch pretty much anything as long as you ask nicely. I got to hold Jon Bon Jovi's guitar, and my friends held Jimi Hendrix's guitar and Miles Davis's trumpet. One of John Lennon's jackets is also on display. The food is typical Hard Rock Cafe menu items including burgers, salads, pasta, dessert and specialty mixed drinks. The service is just OK, nothing to write home about, and definitely expect to wait for a table even if you go in the middle of the day, especially during high tourism seasons.

Photo of Hard Rock Cafe London - London, United Kingdom. Hard Rock Cafe Museum- London

gTbgZ5z2_4fe7pvCb7nFlQ.text: I'm not sure why the Hard Rock Cafe is linked with the Apollo Theatre in Victoria because, unless you take the bus or tube, it is a decent 15+ minute walk from the theatre and therefore unless you get to Hard Rock quite early for a meal (say 5.30) chances are you will be rushing your meal and to your show that no doubt starts at 7.30. But anyway, I wanted to see Billy Elliot and this currently seems to be the best offer around. For £60 we got excellent seats in the Dress Circle and a 2 course meal plus softdrink (from a limited set menu) at Hard Rock. We arrived at Hard Rock Cafe at around 5.45 and it was absolutely heaving. There was one guy handling the seating arrangements and my first, of two gripes, with the Hard Rock Cafe was that this guy was not great at handling pressure and totally unhelpful. The conditions of our deal was that we had to make a reservation, which we did. Obviously there were a lot of walk-ins to Hard Rock Cafe and not enough tables so fair enough the walk-in lot got sent to the bar to wait for a table (the wait at the time was given as between 45 mins to an hour!) When I informed this guy that we'd made a reservation his reply was to add us to the waiting list, to give us a buzzer and to assure us that we would get the first free table. My issue with this was that he didn't even bother checking our reservation which, if he'd done his job properly, he should have seen that one of the few empty tables was allocated to us and seated us straight away. Normally I wouldn't have minded but as we had to be out of there by 7.15 at the latest to make our show we were a bit concerned we would be late. Further, its not like this is a new offer so staff should have been aware of the time constraints for diners on this deal. When I asked for a menu so we could at least choose our meal and have it ready for when we were seated he couldn't even do that and just ushered us to the bar. He quickly scooted away so I tracked down another more helpful member of staff. This is my second gripe - the person who had taken our reservation had failed to make note we were on the Billy Elliot offer so the staff didn't know which menu to give us. Although the girl was very helpful and in fact arranged that we be seated straight away she had no clue which menu to give us and as a result there was confusion as to what we could order. Finally after about 15 mins we received the right menu and placed our orders. From that point on the service was perfect though I did have difficulty understanding our Eastern European waitress. However, she was excellent, extremely efficient and super-friendly even allowing us to upgrade one of our desserts for nothing! She also gave us tickets to enter the museum (which unfortunately we didn't really have time for.) Food was delivered quite promptly and it was very delicious. I would like to give Hard Rock Cafe another go because the food (selection includes burgers, grills, barbecue, salads etc) we received was quite good and the meals that other diners around us received looked equally appetising. The restaurant itself also had a nice vibe (if a bit loud) and most staff, barring the first hopeless guy we encountered, were generally fantastic. But I really was a bit turned off by my two gripes.

3lDSjcxu8CHUPkr4dk4vqQ.text: Went there to a gig and was very disappointed, got there early and queued up, got right up front on the rail but as my friend is disabled and wanted to sit were forced to go back to the raised platform near the bar, where lots of leery youths proceeded to push their way in front of us so we had no view of the stage at all. Complaints to the staff were futile. Wouldn't waste money on going there again.

XnhmKEd05X1CMcWIHxJRDw.text: I always go to Hard Rock Cafe no matter where I am in the world and I always enjoy the food and the London branch was no exception in fact it was the best burger that I have ever had in a Hard Rock. It was a weekend night that I visited and place was buzzing. Had to wait around 40 mintues for a table but not a problem as just had a few drinks at bar. As always with Hard Rock cocktails are good but expensive. Prices for food are also quite pricy exspecially the starter but the portion sizes are huge. Staff are great and really friendly and I will definatly go back next time I am in London.

4k8Mw_wcOXQE40LnqY25zA.text: We have been quite a few times but the last visit was marred by finding large piece of blue paper towel in mashed potatoes. The member of staff we reported this to was quite dismissive and laughed about it - he offered me a cocktail - which we declined. It rather put us off dessert and we will not be visiting again.

pDg-oP2SXSP1eI1M7rl2pA.text: Hard Rock Café ROCKS! I love this place. The food is great and the service is cool. I don't like the noise. Sometimes you can't enjoy a conversation with the people that are joining you for a meal. Sometimes there is a live band which makes that all acceptable, but I like to enjoy a good conversation when going out for a meal. Anyhow, this place is still great and I love their burgers. The Hard Rock Café shop is full of cool stuff with the company logo but its all just a little to expensive. Food cost is acceptable normally between £10 to £15 a head. A great birthday venue - as long as your not paying for everyone!!!

CcWoI9MmBLywpO2QGdsSvQ.text: The only reason why I'm giving this place three stars is because their customer service was great!Their food was not. I had their Chicken Buffalo Blue Cheese Burger and Fries, and it was disgusting. I took one bite and threw the rest away. I didn't order anything else due to the lack of time, but the waitress didn't charge me for the order.

ISK282FCjb6BqkLaLwF6Wg.text: I have to agree with the others comments on the Hard Rock, being a touristy thing. I was not looking for a burger, or anything, I just wanted to get a sweatshirt, before moving back to the States. The line was long for those wanting to eat, so I found a nice bench in Hyde Park until opening time, and was able to snag my sweatshirt in a matter of moments to be on my way. The staff were friendly, and helpful, the crowd mostly Americans. One of those, been there, done that places. Nothing special, but fun while you're there.

RG_c0O8ZloyyWjMBwhoVEg.text: If I die, and suddenly find myself here, I will know that I have made some seriously poor decisions in my life.Sucks.  Awful, crowded, overpriced tourist trap.  Terrible food.  You will be better off getting a nice kebab or some curry from some little shop.

xHSNwokFPJmG5tsnxihIvA.text: Lunch today was too say the least, CRAP! Sent the burger back TWICE and asked for the bill 3 times before finally going to the hostess and telling her she's gonna have to chase me down the street for payment, if I need to ask again. Finally, the server with an attitude arrived and handed me the bill. Comped the food, reluctantly, just left the drinks on the bill. I don't expect FREE anything and was grateful but after all the hard rocks in this world I have been to, my own country is the one to spoil it for me. Sad!!! I'll need to try to like another when I get back to the US!

m7M5aT6TO3-SDL29qGmhyA.text: I few years back while RON at Meldenhaul, a few of us went into London with everything but a clue where to eat. We played it safe, and lost. This place is a huge tourist trap with people waiting for t-shirts and other crapola. My burger tasted like mush and for all I know, could have been ground werewolf. The fries were limp and nasty. The worst part was the bill. Way over priced even for London. Next time, I'll ask a local which is what all of us should do when we travel. And why not, they live there, they should know.

tfmjS6fRq3o9M9nJpmqmnA.text: ...Yeah I came here when I was in college......From waht I recall of this original Hard Rock Cafe......Standard food, wait is not bad... It's all right...

8Nv1SVIGjJSXm20lPUyacw.text: Maybe it is just me but I really don't rate the Hard Rock Cafe! I've been 3 times firstly for a family event, second and third time to give someone ' the experience'. Whist others in the party have had a great time I've never really got it. True the portions are ample - North American standard really - but the quality of the food and service is nothing great. So far, nothing too bad but then came my last visit a week ago and I really didn't expect the two veggies in the party to end up with stomach upsets! They described the veggie burger as undercooked and indigestible and they suffered for not sending it back to be cooked properly. The meat eaters amongst us found the food cooked well but the service a bit erratic. The rock music was OK, the memorabilia impressive I suppose but it would be depressing if 'rock' was the greatest contribution of the 20th century to human culture. I suppose the cafe seemed just a little fake to me, almost a parody of itself - but perhaps I'm being a little harsh. It would have been 3 stars without the dodgy veggie food - will I go again? No, not worth it and certainly not worth queueing for!

ZaF_RljwSOcNPCEdvnO2Nw.text: I was surfing the UK Yelp and OMG, first original Hard Rock Cafe, in London...I always would love to write a review about this  place which brings me so many good and happy memories with their eclectic decor  "what Hard Rock is", as I grew up in London.  As I recall the waitresses used to wear short, tight, white nurse uniform. Not sure they're wearing the same uniforms now since the brand has changed.HRC has been so commercialized now that the used to be fun rock image brand has been changed so much. Now there is a Hard Rock Cafe Museum, Hotel, etc. My favorite food was club sandwich in addtion to best burgers in London/ fries and I still remember the taste of the food. Best apple pies and banana split was just amazing.This place was a "ROCK" a symbol of US image and  an icon in London and hope the spirit of rock 'n' roll always present. I wouldn't hesitate to visit again. A Massive "H3LLO" As good as it gets for this original Hard Rock Cafe. "Cheers"

rWaY5zT8HosSTgh0wkumCQ.text: I like it so much here. All the drinks are great and the best part, of course, is the music. They play all my favorite tracks from the best bands. It's also the perfect place for meeting friends. Naturally, you have to be a little bit of a rock fan to like the cafe. But who isn't :)

7kIMtvcXSw7BRSYz-kP4Pw.text: I have to disagree with a previous reviewer, English food is bad.  We know it, and even they know it.  So for a visiting American, the Hard Rock is a dietary life saver.  Keep in mind, like all international Hard Rock's, the place gets packed.  One thing I have learned in all my international travels, is that the Hard Rock can also act like a mini U.S. embassy.  You can go there and find a very cool American who won't mind spending a few moments giving you advice on directions and recommendations.  So actually, they are better than the embassy.  The food is on par with every other Hard Rock.  The service is decent, but busy.  The Hard Rock London also is a celeb magnet, if you're into that sort of thing.

V_UI7K9DvIqIRBdkXhQLtg.text: My first experience with Hard Rock Cafe was on a family holiday to San Francisco back in 2001 but sadly I didn't get the chance to go back to one until quite a few years later and its was the slightly closer to home London branch that we visited and I'm glad that we did.Despite being a little pricey for what the food is (think TGI Friday's) its always well cooked and delivered by some of the most cheerful and helpful waiting staff in the business (this is a tip for waiting staff elsewhere, I ALWAYS tip well in H.R.C because the staff always appear to actually care that we are enjoying ourselves!).Every-time we've been there we've always had a fab time as the atmosphere has been top notch and despite some of the music being of the American Hillbilly Rock variety its normally songs that you know so you find yourself tapping your feet and admiring the beautiful memorabilia collection that they've got stashed around and between the tables.Since that first visit we've been to 7 different H.R.C's across the globe but we always come back to the London one as in my opinion, it's the first and still the best. :)P.S. If you have time, try to get across the road to the Hard Rock Vault (in the basement of the Hard Rock Store), the tours take about 10mins and if you are a Rock N Roll fan its well worth seeing some of the bits they've got stashed away in there.

etsel7md4ifvGblky4TMSg.text: Why 5 stars? Because we were able to be seated straight away! Don't hate, I don't know if being Asian had anything to do with it, but we had outstanding service! The food is typical Hard Rock Cafe, so no big woop on the food, but it was super cool that we sat close to Jimi Hendrix's display! Of course it's touristy, it's the original Hard Rock Cafe, just like going to CBGB in NYC!

3ThS94ShSoLcQPgLByhsXA.text: Great place and food. Our waiter was awesome and so friendly. Have been there twice when we visit the UK and will continue to go back.

wYMqbLPHdH_ACjjU9fwDKQ.text: This is the first Hard Rock cafe I have ever visited. Five years ago. I had an apple pie. It was quite tasty, but too sweet. I liked the glasses they served cranberry juice in. After eating, we got something like a pass and we could go to the basement where they had a lot of guitars. There was a man working there and cleaning the guitars. Before we entered the room, the waitress told us not to touch anything, but later that guitar supervisor let me hold Kurt Cobain's guitar and even put his glasses on :oSo, I had a wonderful experience!

tjQPuihQpg4zfM50rZMdew.text: Went Sunday prior to Bon Jovi gig. 6 of us in total and didn't have to wait too long for a table,just enough to have a beer at the bar. Staff were excellent and really looked after us. They knew everything on the menu and all was served in good time. Cost of the meal wasn't cheap but for the size of the portions well worth it.Would highly recommend if in London and great for a group of you

eDEDYgXIbADMiNgLeKp-NA.text: Ok so I'm giving this four stars as I had a free meal here and I must say that the burgers are delicious  however the prices are way over what I'd pay for them. I've never been to a Hard Rock before (and they certainly seem to have loyal devotees who visit a branch in every city they visit) and to be honest I don't think I'd go back off my own back. Definitely worth a visit once to check it out but over priced at the end of the day. I think if I'd paid myself I'd probably knock off another star

9WARkiEWXm9hUG9c_5RtxA.text: make sure you book a table, this place is very popular and i never saw the queue grow shorter.great nachos and a huge smokehouse platter that has a great sauce.I will definetly come here again but hopefully find a deal as its rather pricey for tex mex

LD5t6-Ex11Mq-TokcJc7wA.text: Good Hard Rockthe staff was very nice an cared about everything. It is always very full and a great spot to meet people. The food is good but gets more expensive every year. If u like Hard Rock Cafe don't miss this one.

m96qdEkn-JMnjkDKccwGSw.text: It's the original Hard Rock Cafe, what more can you ask for.  I had free passes to jump the extraordinary long line which was provided by the concierge by my hotel down the street The Intercontinental off Park Lane.  Without those line jumper passes I would have had to wait almost 2 hours just to get  an American dish in London and that's definitely not worth the wait,  maybe,  since it was the FIRST Hard Rock Cafe opened in 1971.   There were two levels and it's much bigger than it looked from the outside.  The food portions are big and it's definitely classic American. Overall a tourist joint and nice stop for a big group during dinner on the way down to the Piccadilly Circus area.

asZMnS543PzRjp9pa47xSA.text: Fantastic restaurant. Genuinely think these are some of the best burgers you will find in the UK and it's even better when you are surrounded by such famous musical items. Staff are also very friendly.If you're looking for a sophisticated restaurant then stay away, but Hard Rock is great if you just want to have fun.
